title: Surgical Tool Tracking System using Artificial Intelligence
description: The Surgical Tool Tracking System is a computer vision project that uses AI to track surgical tools in real-time. This is used to identify which tools are being used too often and will help reduce waste and costs. The system uses a camera to capture the surgical tools and then uses a custom-trained YOLOv11 model to detect and classify the tools. The system then tracks the tools and displays the tracking information on the screen as well as the bounding boxes of each tool. The system is built with Java, OpenCV, and ONNX.

title: Course-Connect
description: Course Connect is a web application that allows students to view courses offered by UCF and rate them. The application also allows students to view the comments of other students and see the average rating of a course. The application is built with React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.

title: Lemon Drop
description: A 36-hour hackathon project designed to modernize dashcam technology. Lemon Drop connects to dashcams via a Raspberry Pi, automatically downloads footage when in WiFi range, and hosts a local web server for managing multiple dashcams and their recordings. Built with Python's Flask and a custom network setup, this solution simplifies dashcam management.

title: Megabytes
description: Megabytes is a social media app and website that allows users to publish their own recipes and share them with others. Some notable features are being able to post a recipe online, comment and like other recipes, and generate recipes using AI by inputting a food name. The platform is built with React, React Native, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB. It also uses JWT for authentication and bcrypt for password encryption.

title: BeanBook Contacts
description: BeanBook Contacts is a contact management system that allows users to store and manage their contacts. Some notable features are being able to add, edit, and delete contacts. The platform is built with HTML/CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and MySQL.

title: PL/0 Compiler & Virtual Machine
description: PL/0 Compiler is a compiler build in the C programming language for the PL/0 programming language which is an educational programming language used to teach compiler design. A program written in Pl/0 is inputted and is tokenized, parsed, and then translated into machine code. The machine code is then executed by a virtual machine.

title: Hoyolab Automatic Daily Check-In Bot
description: The daily check-in bot is a Discord bot built using DiscordJS and NodeJS that automatically checks in for the daily rewards in Genshin Impact and Honkai Starrail. The bot uses the the same API calls that hoyolab.com uses to automate the process of checking in on the Hoyolab website.

title: Rust Calculator
description: Rust Calculator is a simple calculator built with Rust. The calculator can perform basic arithmetic operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, modulo, and exponents. The calculator follows an infix to postfix conversion algorithm to evaluate the expression.

title: Minecraft Java Edition Plugins
description: A collection of Minecraft Java Edition plugins that I have created. Some notable plugins are a Ultra Hardcore, Hardcore, and Advanced Reactions. The plugins are built with Java and the PaperMC API. The plugins are used to enhance the gameplay experience of Minecraft servers.

title: Checksum Evaluation
description: A 8-, 16-, and 32-bit checksum evaluation program that calculates the checksum of a given file. The program is built with Java and uses bitwise operations to calculate the checksum of a file. The program is used to verify the integrity of a file by comparing the calculated checksum to the expected checksum.

title: Portfolio Website
description: My personal portfolio website that showcases my projects, skills, and experience. The website is built with React and TypeScript. The website is responsive and mobile-friendly. The website is hosted on GitHub Pages.
